sentences.sContent: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.sCn: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

sentences.sContent: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
sentences.sCn: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？

sentences.sContent: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
sentences.sCn: 他没有生气，反而似乎很高兴。

sentences.sContent: ...instead of focusing on a given feature...
...Let’s put this person in a residential care home instead of a nursing home—she will be much better off...
...the gift money must be put in the red envelope instead of the white envelope...
...But customers cannot be forced to order salads instead of fries...
...Relationships in the real world are maintained through human contact and spending time with each other instead of chitchatting online...
...most families ate dinner at home instead of eating out...
...conducting experiments instead of sinking cups in the bathtub...
...Why not instead think of learning as if it were food--something so valuable to humans that they have evolved to experience it as a pleasure...
...Becoming educated should not require giving up joy but rather lead to finding joy in new kinds of things: reading novels instead of playing with small figures...

trans.tranOther: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc
